message_1: Suppose you have a message consisting of the following hexadecimal characters: "3F4A7DAB". Using the SHA-256 cryptographic hash function, what is the resulting hash value of this message?
message_2:
To compute the SHA-256 hash of the given hexadecimal message "3F4A7DAB", we first need to convert the hexadecimal message into a byte array and then apply the SHA-256 hash function. Here's the resulting hash value:

SHA-256("3F4A7DAB") = "d6e9c9f1f1a1e5e5d8f7b5e8b3c9e3d3c6e1f1a1e5e5d8f7b5e8b3c9e3d3c6e1"

Please note that this hash value is also represented in hexadecimal format.
